ygData.subject: Re: zoning
ygData.msgSnippet: I have played over T1 ( Old slow Tech) and my zone time was 8-10 seconds. About the same for my cable modem. I agree it is the line speed that affects the
ygData.messageBody:
I have played over T1 ( Old slow Tech) and my zone
time was 8-10 seconds. About the same for my cable
modem. I agree it is the line speed that affects the
zoneing time. My machine is a AMD 333 64MB with 8MB
Video I also have a Ultra SCSI drive which probable
has some affect when loading the zone graphics over
slower IDE drives. I played over a DS3 connection as
well and it was not much different as far a zone times
go. Ofcourse there is also the 2500 other people in
the building that have nothing better to do but surf
the web. Clogs up the line. Thats your tax dollars
hard at work on the TY site. I just changed jobs
however and now my work machine is serviced by a proxy
that wont pass EQ data. :(

--- "Lary, William" <WLary@...> wrote:
> From: "Lary, William" <WLary@...>
>
>
>
>
> Hiya
> i have a amd 400mhz 64mb of ps100 ram 16mb video
> card-banshee
> and an awesome creative 128bit sound card. however i
> have NEVER zoned in
> less than a minute, usually more, i know a lot of it
> is processor
> i have hit zones withgroups and i am the last one to
> wake up so to speak
> the others had p2 350mhz etc i do have a 33.6 modem
> so i think it is
> the modem connection that makes the biggest
> difference, i wish my work
> computer had a cd rom drive installed, its just a
> p266 with 80mb but the
> 45kps T1 connection would surely be nice as opposed
> to my
> 3.5 to about 4.0kps i get with my 33.6 modem. does
> anyone out there
> play on a recommended p200 or above system req and
> use a T1?
> i wold love to know the zone times ya get:)
> Doublestar
>
>
